Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Dexamethasone as an Analgesic Adjuvant in Minimally Invasive Thoracic Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were divided into two groups: 46 received dexamethasone 8 mg at induction, and 24 received ondansetron 4 mg before extubation.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the University Hospital of Trieste, Italy, from January 10, 2017, to November 6, 2019, this retrospective cohort study included adults undergoing elective lobectomy, segmentectomy, or wedge resection with mini-thoracotomy or VATS.

Intervention.evidence: 46 received dexamethasone 8 mg at induction, and 24 received ondansetron 4 mg before extubation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was morphine consumption 24 hours post-surgery.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 46 received dexamethasone 8 mg at induction, and 24 received ondansetron 4 mg before extubation.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference in morphine consumption at 24 hours was observed between groups (p = 0.09).

Harms.evidence: No surgical wound infections were detected, and PONV incidence was similar.
